question:
You are a math expert. When you respond, respond only with the Solution of the final Problem, thinking step by step. At the end of the Solution, when you give your final answer, write it in the form 'Final Answer: \\boxed{$answer$}. I hope it is correct.'
Find the sum of the quotient and remainder when $6x^3+9x^2-17x+11$ is divided by $2x^2+5x-1$.
inference:
To find the quotient and remainder when $6x^3+9x^2-17x+11$ is divided by $2x^2+5x-1$, we perform polynomial long division.

$$
\begin{array}{c|cc cc}
\multicolumn{2}{r}{3x} & -1 \\
\cline{2-5}
2x^2+5x-1 & 6x^3+9x^2-17x+11 \\
\multicolumn{2}{r}{6x^3+15x^2-3x} \\
\cline{2-3}
\multicolumn{2}{r}{0} & -6x^2-14x+11 \\
\multicolumn{2}{r}{} & -6x^2-15x+3 \\
\cline{3-4}
\multicolumn{2}{r}{} & 0 & x+8 \\
\end{array}
$$
The quotient is $3x-1$ and the remainder is $x+8$.

The sum of the quotient and remainder is $(3x-1)+(x+8) = 4x+7$.
Final Answer: $\boxed{4x+7}$

$$
\begin{array}{c|cc cc}
\multicolumn{2}{r}{3x} & -1 \\
\cline{2-5}
2x^2+5x-1 & 6x^3+9x^2-17x+11 \\

The quotient is $3x-1$ and the remainder is $x+8$.

inference:
The correct polynomial long division is:

$$
\begin{array}{c|cc cc}
\multicolumn{2}{r}{3x} & -3 \\
\cline{2-5}
2x^2+5x-1 & 6x^3+9x^2-17x+11 \\
\multicolumn{2}{r}{6x^3+15x^2-3x} \\
\cline{2-3}
\multicolumn{2}{r}{0} & -6x^2-14x+11 \\
\multicolumn{2}{r}{} & -6x^2-15x+3 \\
\cline{3-4}
\multicolumn{2}{r}{} & 0 & x+8 \\
\end{array}
$$
The quotient is $3x-3$ and the remainder is $x+8$.
The sum of the quotient and remainder is $(3x-3)+(x+8) = 4x+5$.

Final Answer: $\boxed{4x+5}$
